body.p: To his Excellency the Gov of Ky B. Magoffin

The undersigned would beg leave to state and pray the intervention of executive clemency. That Mr John H Orbry was fined at the last term of the Scott Circuit the sum of $20.00 the costs pertaining to the trial making the whole sum $28.80 The offense alledged was a misdemeanor in disturbing the peace when in truth and in fact as your petitioners ^believe^ There was ^not^ criminality on the part of Orbry sufficient to warrant the above verdict -- and upon the trial from the circumstances of the case Deft could not bring out the whole truth of the case -- Mr Orbry is a very industrious man and of good character He is in very indigent circumstances and has a large family who depend upon the work of his hands for their daily bread -- He cannot raise the rum adjudged against him without a sacrifice of his few personal chattels indispensible to the comfort of his family We would therefore present him to you as a subject demanding your clemency and pray your Excellency to remit his fine.
